intro: Cadetia subfalcata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and small, alternate leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Cadetia subfalcata is generally hardy and adapted to poor soils, making it a resilient plant in arid or disturbed environments.
